alert.note: Alert for Northern Lycoming; Southern Lycoming; Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 2:36PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY RAIN MIXED WITH SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN LYCOMING...SULLIVAN... AND NORTHERN LYCOMING COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy rain mixed with snow accompanied by winds of up to 45 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a half of a mile. The snow may drop road surface temperatures quickly, and may create slick roadways. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 233 PM EST, a band of heavy rain mixed with snow was along a line extending from Canton to near Williamsport and moving east at 55 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Barbours around 250 PM EST. Kettle Creek Gorge and Lincoln Falls around 300 PM EST. Muncy Valley around 305 PM EST. Ricketts Glen State Park around 320 PM EST. Route 220 is the largest road which will be impacted by this rain and snow band. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
